title: How do Hydropower Mechanics Work?

How do Hydropower Mechanics Work?

Roberto Baldizon
Mar 9

Climate Change is happening, even if one does or does not agree with the scientifically accepted hypothesis of anthropogenic emission, we all have to understand that our planet’s atmosphere is changing, and with it, our weather and therefore our habits should adapt too. There are simple steps which we could all take to slow down this phenomenon by reducing the amount of carbon in our atmosphere. One of the measures which our businesses and government could take is to go all in for renewable electricity generation. In this article, we will examine from a general spectrum how does hydropower work.

Hydropower plants are composed, traditionally, of reservoirs which hold enough water to allow for greater energy build up when let through turbines to produce electricity. A typical system is presented here in the general layout below.

Fluid Behavior

The carrier of energy in this system is water, and it is a liquid fluid, those it behaves as such. Luckily for us, there have been a plethora of brilliant scientists which have dedicated their lives to the description of fluid behavior physically. The equations included below can be used to describe and understand how does water behave at several stages of the hydropower plant system cycle.

Energy

The energy generated by the fluid is converted to electricity through generators presented in the turbine layout below. The generator works by letting the turbine turn with the passing of water and with it, the turbine spins the rotor causing electricity when surrounded by the stator.

Mathematically, this energy conversion can be described by Bernoulli’s Equation and some algebra. Bernoulli’s formulae included below are used to find a power head which converts algebraically the motion of water to watts, the SI unit for energy.

Finding the head produced by the generator in watts for the power plant is a great step in finding the amount of energy it produces at every instant in time, nevertheless to fully convert such measure into electrical power we rely on data, graphs, and formulae which results are summarized in the chart included below.

Please follow up with any feedback or doubts about this article, thanks.
~Roberto Baldizon
